testcase: Single IN-list on leading index key

explain.statement: SELECT true AS present FROM $explan AS p WHERE ANY v WITHIN p.plan.`~children` SATISFIES v.`#operator` = 'IndexScan3' AND v.has_dynamic_in = true and ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans) = 1 AND ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans[0].range) = 1 AND v.spans[0].range[0].dynamic_in = true END

statements: SELECT c21, c22 FROM shellTest WHERE c21 IN $inlist ORDER BY c21, c22

testcase: two IN-lists under OR on same leading index key

explain.statement: SELECT true AS present FROM $explan AS p WHERE ANY v WITHIN p.plan.`~children` SATISFIES v.`#operator` = 'IndexScan3' AND v.has_dynamic_in = true and ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans) > 1 AND ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans[1].range) = 1 AND v.spans[1].range[0].dynamic_in = true END

statements: SELECT c21, c22 FROM shellTest WHERE c21 IN $inlist OR c21 IN $inlist2 ORDER BY c21, c22

testcase: one IN-list on non-leading index key with non-IN-list predicate on leading index key

explain.statement: SELECT true AS present FROM $explan AS p WHERE ANY v WITHIN p.plan.`~children` SATISFIES v.`#operator` = 'IndexScan3' AND v.has_dynamic_in = true and ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans) = 1 AND ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans[0].range) > 1 AND v.spans[0].range[1].dynamic_in = true END

statements: SELECT c21, c22 FROM shellTest WHERE c21 BETWEEN 1 AND 5 AND c22 IN $inlist ORDER BY c21, c22

testcase: two IN-lists on different index keys

explain.statement: SELECT true AS present FROM $explan AS p WHERE ANY v WITHIN p.plan.`~children` SATISFIES v.`#operator` = 'IndexScan3' AND v.has_dynamic_in = true and ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans) = 1 AND ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans[0].range) > 1 AND v.spans[0].range[0].dynamic_in = true AND v.spans[0].range[1].dynamic_in = true END

statements: SELECT c21, c22 FROM shellTest WHERE c21 IN $inlist AND c22 IN $inlist2 ORDER BY c21, c22

testcase: two IN-lists on non-leading index key, with non-IN-list predicate on leading index key

explain.statement: SELECT true AS present FROM $explan AS p WHERE ANY v WITHIN p.plan.`~children` SATISFIES v.`#operator` = 'IndexScan3' AND v.has_dynamic_in = true and ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans) > 1 AND ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans[0].range) > 1 AND ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans[1].range) > 1 AND v.spans[0].range[1].dynamic_in = true AND v.spans[1].range[1].dynamic_in = true END

statements: SELECT c21, c22 FROM shellTest WHERE c21 BETWEEN 1 AND 5 AND (c22 IN $inlist OR c22 IN $inlist2)

testcase: two IN-lists on non-leading index key, with non-IN-list OR predicate on leading index key

explain.statement: SELECT true AS present FROM $explan AS p WHERE ANY v WITHIN p.plan.`~children` SATISFIES v.`#operator` = 'IndexScan3' AND v.has_dynamic_in = true and ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans) = 6 AND ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans[0].range) > 1 AND ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans[5].range) > 1 AND v.spans[0].range[1].dynamic_in = true AND v.spans[5].range[1].dynamic_in = true END

statements: SELECT c21, c22 FROM shellTest WHERE (c21 = 1 OR c21 = 3 OR c21 = 5) AND (c22 IN $inlist OR c22 IN $inlist2)

testcase: two IN-lists on leading index key, two IN-lists on non-leading index key

explain.statement: SELECT true AS present FROM $explan AS p WHERE ANY v WITHIN p.plan.`~children` SATISFIES v.`#operator` = 'IndexScan3' AND v.has_dynamic_in = true and ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans) = 4 AND ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans[0].range) > 1 AND ARRAY_LENGTH(v.spans[3].range) > 1 AND v.spans[0].range[0].dynamic_in = true AND v.spans[0].range[1].dynamic_in = true AND v.spans[3].range[0].dynamic_in = true AND v.spans[3].range[1].dynamic_in = true END

statements: SELECT c21, c22 FROM shellTest WHERE (c21 IN $inlist OR c21 IN $inlist2) AND (c22 IN $inlist3 OR c22 IN $inlist4)
